page.title: 19CHURCHES: DANE END & AREA
page.content: {All Saints Church}stands in the centre of the parish of Little Munden and overlooks Dane End. Its partly circular churchyard and ancient yew tree may denote a pagan burial site. The building is one of six Hertfordshire churches that contain visible Saxon work. It had a priest at the{Domesday Survey.}Nave and chancel are late 11th century. Remains of a solid Norman wall in the north west corner suggest it then had a narrow aisle. {St. Catherine's Church}stands on a hill over looking the village of {Sacombe.}It dates back to the 12th century but Victorian restoration hides the original structure. During this restoration stained glass windows replaced the original windows and the stone exterior was covered with flints taken from a local disused church.
